column5: Tuesday afternoon fished from 1 p.m until dark and put on a show landing 4 gorgeous hens and losing 3 other fish. It sure was fun seeing everyone standing there since first light and not catching anything and I come down and start hammering into them haha sure is funny!  Thursday morning fished the mouth of the river that everyone else already knows of before i mentioned it on here. and smacked into 3 nice males bout 5 or 6 pounds each.  My buddy landed a nice male resident brown as well bout 5 or 6 pounds again.  Don't worry guys pics are on there way in a day or two.
sounds like a good time,look forward to pics
6 pound resident brown ??  You sure it wasnt a dark lake run fish ?

Sweet!  But ya might wanna be cautious when it comes to specifics...  I know some float fisher folk who are exremely protective of this creek..  That one doesn't need any more pressure than it already gets.  Might wanna save yourself the flack..  I can feel tremors!  It'd be nice to see some fins though!  tight loops HD
Ya, I agree.  Don't mention the Wilmot, whatever you do.   Keep it on the down low.
too late now half the world has seen.
So...where exactly is that and how do I get there?? LOL.

Just another one of the many cricks that drain into Lake Ontario...just like they've done for centuries! There ain't no secrets on Lake O...lets all give our heads a shake there.  Nice report chickenhawk...get them pics posted up with the backgrounds asap!

Speaking or should I say not speaking of that place here's a funny article............. you know about that place we can't speak of. I think someone else is protective of your secret place (read the article LOL). Here you go shhhhhhhhh http://www.fish-hawk.net/hawkshow/wilmot/wilmot.php. Oh Chickenhawk,thanks for sharing. Can't wait to see the pics.
